job_title: Director of Career Services in Montgomery, AL
pros: Depending on your department you have flexibility in running your schedule, good benefits, tuition assistance available (ASU only), state retirement, if you mind your business and do your job wonderful place to work, reserved parking, company laptop, 10% staff discount at bookstore, on site fast food (Subway, Chik-fil-a, Prime Grill, and Starbucks), good student body, nice colleagues, and a lot of tradition when it comes to school pride and sports
cons: Reserved parking cost $300 (I paid though), raises don't come often, no hybrid telework option, you better know what you are doing because there is not a lot of training but if you ask you will get help

review_title: Best Costume Studio Manager Job but NOT the best place
job_title: Costume Studio Manager in Montgomery, AL
pros: The students are terrific.  Costume studio is basement level (as many are!) but it is very well lite, and feels open and spacious.  The most of the equipment is about 5 years old, so it's broken in but not broken down.  They only produce four shows a year plus a 2-night series of one-acts.  Build schedules average 5 weeks on the calendar (reality is different - see "cons").  One or more part-time work study assistants available upon request.  Most faculty are very pleasant and professional.  For me, it's a very easy job overall.
cons: The University is in very serious trouble financially.  Money for purchasing and supplies is unbelievably difficult to acquire and ridiculously slow.  Real build time is often reduced to three weeks due to delays in funding and subsequent supply acquisition - causing needless stress.  It is a very "who you know" institution at nearly every level.  Senior faculty members seem to delight in being difficult and often speak in very unprofessional manners.  There is a very dysfunctional communication and interpersonal pattern between senior faculty and department management.  This unhealthy, chaotic pattern filters out to peers and down to students thereby creating an unnecessarily stressful atmosphere.

job_title: Assistant Director of Strategic Communications in Montgomery, AL
pros: Good starting pay, good people around you
cons: No room for growth. Stepping-stone job

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Montgomery, AL
pros: Intelligent, driven, caring faculty in many areas
cons:
The management is overpaid, incompetent, dishonest, and present based on nepotism. People with no business being in a classroom, much less a corner office, are given control of entire academic labs, promoted to Vice Presidents and they harass staff and faculty to retain students who entered with an 11 ACT.  
The management regularly engage in unprofessional gossip, smear tactics, and back-biting--the type beyond the average academic department. You will see a clear line of someone's cousin, sorority sister, or friend being given a 100k salary and management title while they run around for someone to manage.

pros: Enjoy working with international students.  Have basic benefits and holidays.  If you work here you get off almost a month for christmas.  In the summer you have Friday's off if you do the 12 hour a day Monday-Thursday schedule.
cons: Some of the students are not college ready (still living that thug life).  They will give you a free class each semester as an employee, but then they turn around and charge $800.00 administration fee per semester.  They also charge alot for parking.

pros: Calm atmosphere and good employees.  The health benefits are very good, but not great.  To advance in salary you have to acquire a different title, they are not good at giving performance raises.  You get 8 hours per month of annual leave and 8 hours of sick leave.  After so many years you get 10 hours per month and then it goes to 15 hours per month.
cons: Job growth is limited unless you are faculty.

review_title: Overall, the interview process went well.
pros: One of the benefits of working at this institution is the flexibility of scheduling.  I can request certain days and times I want to teach.   My supervisor tries to accommodate me.
cons: Sometimes we can have a few too many meetings.  The committee work and assignments are comparable to other universities in the area, but I'm uncertain if they have as many meetings.

review_title: They're always in the news for a reason...
pros: I loved working with the students.
cons: Lack of support from upper management, the immediate supervisor is combative, rude, and confused; you, there is no room for growth, and they make their own policies without any system of checks and balances. You have no support. You have to watch your back, front, and side.

review_title: Love ASU and loved being a Graduate Assistant
pros:
It's a great time to be a hornet.
ASU is among the colleges with the best graduate assistant-ship jobs that pay well and possibility of getting a full time job are very high. 
A lot of opportunities to learn, grow and lead. 
I love my ASU and I loved being a student there and a graduate assistant.
cons: Jesus fix the university management and all the drama.

review_title: A Great Time To Be A Hornet
pros: Great place to work because the university offers a great education to our students and staff.  You will find some of the best people in the world to work with and know for a lifetime.  Great opportunities as a whole.
cons: It not so good with you work with someone for a long time and the person leaves the university without further contact or connection.

pros: Alabama State University has great facilities within their health sciences and some great professors. Alabama State University is easily accessible from the interstate.
cons: Alabama State University struggles deeply to finance and support its most outstanding programs. Board members of the university consistently are involved in legal troubles.

pros: The class sizes are usually smaller than average.
cons: Higher than average teaching load.  Research funding is very limited (next to none.) Faculty travel funding is also very limited.
